Module com.example.navalbattle
Package com.example.navalbattle.interfaces

Interface PositionTableInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
PositionTable
public interface PositionTableInterface
Interface representing a player's position table in the Naval Battle game. It defines the actions for placing ships, checking positions, and managing the game board.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    checkAmount(int shipIndex)
    Checks if there are any remaining ships of a given type to place.

    checkPosition(int shipIndex, int row, int col, int orientation)
    Checks if a ship can be placed at the given position.
    int[][]
    getBoard()
    Returns the player's 10x10 position table where ships are placed.
    List<int[]>
    getShipCoordinatesList()
    Returns the list of coordinates where ships have been placed.
    ArrayList<Ship>
    getShips()
    Returns a list of ships available for placement on the board.

    Returns the 10x10 shot grid for tracking shots on the board.

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      int[][] getBoard()
      Returns the player's 10x10 position table where ships are placed.
      Returns:
      the 2D array representing the player's ship position grid.

    • getShotGrid

      int[][] getShotGrid()
      Returns the 10x10 shot grid for tracking shots on the board.
      Returns:
      the 2D array representing the shot grid.

    • getShips

      ArrayList<Ship> getShips()
      Returns a list of ships available for placement on the board.
      Returns:
      the list of ships.

    • setShipPosition

      void setShipPosition(int shipIndex, int row, int col, int orientation)
      Sets the position of a ship on the board, given the ship index, row, column, and orientation.
      Parameters:
      shipIndex - the index of the ship to be placed.
      row - the row where the ship should be placed.
      col - the column where the ship should be placed.
      orientation - the orientation of the ship (0 for horizontal, 1 for vertical).

    • checkPosition

      boolean checkPosition(int shipIndex, int row, int col, int orientation)
      Checks if a ship can be placed at the given position.
      Parameters:
      shipIndex - the index of the ship to be placed.
      row - the row where the ship should be placed.
      col - the column where the ship should be placed.
      orientation - the orientation of the ship (0 for horizontal, 1 for vertical).
      Returns:
      true if the ship can be placed, false otherwise.

    • checkAmount

      boolean checkAmount(int shipIndex)
      Checks if there are any remaining ships of a given type to place.
      Parameters:
      shipIndex - the index of the ship type.
      Returns:
      true if there are ships of this type left to place, false otherwise.

    • printBoard

      void printBoard()
      Prints the current state of the player's board.

    • isBoardFull

      boolean isBoardFull()
      Checks if the board is fully populated with all ships.
      Returns:
      true if the board is full, false otherwise.

    • getShipCoordinatesList

      List<int[]> getShipCoordinatesList()
      Returns the list of coordinates where ships have been placed.
      Returns:
      the list of ship coordinates.
